refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Parses str as if it were the query string passed via an URL and sets variables in the current scope. If the second parameter arr is present, variables are stored in this variable as an array elements instead.

note.para: Support for the optional second parameter was added in PHP 4.0.3.
To get the current QUERY_STRING, you may use the variable $_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']. Also, you may want to read the section on variables from outside of PHP.

example.title: Using parse_str
example.programlisting:
<?php $str = "first=value&arr[]=foo+bar&arr[]=baz"; parse_str($str); echo $first; // value echo $arr[0]; // foo bar echo $arr[1]; // baz
parse_str($str, $output); echo $output['first']; // value echo $output['arr'][0]; // foo bar echo $output['arr'][1]; // baz
?>

refsect1.para: See also parse_url, pathinfo, set_magic_quotes_runtime, and urldecode.
